DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Outcome Result Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor response evaluation score that decribes the radiologist's impression of the PET/CT.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. _A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Outcome Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Tumor response evaluation score based on  PET/CT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake, but can be attributed to inflammation activity.

Concepts.definition: A finding of metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake, but can be attributed to inflammation activity, as detected by FDG-PET.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of focal metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake.

Concepts.longName: Likely Residual Metabolic Tumor Activity by PET
Concepts.definition: A finding of focal metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake, as detected by FDG-PET.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of diffuse metabolic activity at the primary tumor or nodal sites that is greater than background uptake but less than liver uptake.

Concepts.longName: Likely Tumor Complete Metabolic Response by PET
Concepts.definition: A finding of diffuse metabolic activity at the primary tumor or nodal sites that is greater than background uptake but less than liver uptake, detected by PDG-PET.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of disappearance of metabolic tumor activity in target and non-target lesions, marked by a decrease in tumor standardized uptake value to the level of surrounding normal tissue.

Concepts.longName: Tumor Complete Metabolic Response by PET
Concepts.definition: A finding obtained using FDG-PET imaging demonstrating the disappearance of metabolic tumor activity in target and non-target lesions, marked by a decrease in tumor standardized uptake value to the level of surrounding normal tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of strong focal metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake.

Concepts.longName: Definite Residual Metabolic Tumor Activity by PET
Concepts.definition: A finding of strong focal metabolic activity at the primary or nodal sites that is greater than liver uptake, as detected by FDG-PET.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
